title: Can anyone help me with calligraphy pen? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are a beginner and just want your handwriting to look different and better , then try the pens which are easy to use and manipulate. If you plan to pursue professional calligraphy then its a different thing.   I have written with 3 different pens in the same amount of time without taking any extra effort. Montex MINI ball pen : 10 INRParker Vector Calligraphy pen : 200 INRHero Calligraphy pen 5028 series : 375 INRYou can use the Parker and the Hero pen on a daily basis provided you are not writing on a very absorbent paper. These calligraphy pens use humongous amounts of ink and would actually completely soak a absorbent paper. Check out a couple of nibs with different widths and find out which ones suit you the best. A Parker beginner calligraphy set is easily available on Amazon and provides different nib widths with a single pen. Practice with all the different pens you can get your hands on. And one day you will find the one that suits you the best. Its like finding your own dragon in the fairy tales . The moment you touch it , you will know that your minds connected.

It depends what you want to do with it. Sharpie chisel tip markers will work as a very large nib width calligraphy pen (if you want to make posters or something similar). Personally I like the cartridge pen sets for writing. If you are taking a class, you may want one of the old “dip” pens with a “C” nib, and India ink, which is pricey. Permanent ink will gum up your nib. It also depends on what lettering style you want to make. The “classical” calligraphy style uses a “C” nib, but more typography-like styles use other nibs, such as “B”. Akhil, would you give us some more details on what kind of calligraphy you’re interested in? And may your writing endeavors go well.
